author: Paul Hofius

review: Just so you're not fooled by the ads, this isn't REALLY a "just plug in and play" sort of deal. Depending on the type of tv you have, you might need to plug in the HDMI cable included in the box, and if your wifi connection is anything like mine, might take half the night getting your firewalls to allow the device access. Once finally set up and connected, however, it does exactly what I need it to do. I have a phone to access Netflix and Hulu, and use my Chromebook to cast Amazon Prime/tv channel websites. It probably won't replace Roku/Xbox/Playstation if you have it streaming through there, but it is easier and less space consuming than my hooking my laptop up to the tv.  I'm glad I bought it.
author: Nerdyesque "Nerdyesque"

review: Does not work with kindle fire HD but does work from android phones for Netflix.  Also good with iPad, iPhone 4S and laptop. Another nice feature is that it can be easily moved between tv's without having to reconfigure casting options. Only four stars because it doesn't work with the kindle...Google needs to address this functionality as they advertise this heavily as being functional with android devises.  Misleading advertising regarding android devises cost the review two stars.
